intro: Scorzonera kandavanica, commonly known as the Kandavan scuron, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, elongated tubers that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
